p: Two years later, a research team from the same facility conducted another experiment confirming the antibacterial activity of A. dracunculus oil against Staphylococcus aureus, Klebsiella spp. , Salmonella typhimurium, Staphylococcus epidermidis, Proteus spp. and Corynebacterium diphtheriae. The essential oil was tested with agar well diffusion. A significant inhibitory effect on the growth of S. aureus, Proteus spp. and C. diphtheriae bacterial strains was demonstrated. The MIC value for these bacteria was determined using the essential oil at a concentration of 0.03 and 25Â mg/ml ( Tajbakhsh and Soleimani, 2018).
